text:
On an unrelated note, here is how I convert Pandas dataframes to julia. Maybe someone else will find it useful.  Pandas helps with reading/writing from gcs/s3 and uses the blazing fast cpp parquet implementation. This method seems to be faster than using Pandas.jl
```import Pandas
using PyCall
using DataFrames
using Arrow
pd = pyimport("pandas")
pa = pyimport("pyarrow")

function convert_pandas_df_to_julia_df(df_pd::PyObject)
    df_arrow = pa.Table.from_pandas(df_pd)
    sink = pa.BufferOutputStream()
    writer = pa.ipc.new_stream(sink, df_arrow.schema)
    writer.write_table(df_arrow)
    pa_buf = sink.getvalue()
    byte_vector = Vector(reinterpret(UInt8, pa_buf))
    tbl = Arrow.Table(byte_vector)
    df = DataFrame(tbl; copycols=false)
    return df
end

df = pd.read_parquet("gs://...") |> 
    convert_pandas_df_to_julia_df ```

elements.text: On an unrelated note, here is how I convert Pandas dataframes to julia. Maybe someone else will find it useful.  Pandas helps with reading/writing from gcs/s3 and uses the blazing fast cpp parquet implementation. This method seems to be faster than using Pandas.jl

import Pandas
using PyCall
using DataFrames
using Arrow
pd = pyimport("pandas")
pa = pyimport("pyarrow")

function convert_pandas_df_to_julia_df(df_pd::PyObject)
    df_arrow = pa.Table.from_pandas(df_pd)
    sink = pa.BufferOutputStream()
    writer = pa.ipc.new_stream(sink, df_arrow.schema)
    writer.write_table(df_arrow)
    pa_buf = sink.getvalue()
    byte_vector = Vector(reinterpret(UInt8, pa_buf))
    tbl = Arrow.Table(byte_vector)
    df = DataFrame(tbl; copycols=false)
    return df
end

df = pd.read_parquet("gs://...") |> 
    convert_pandas_df_to_julia_df
